embeds.title: Safeguard
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Gain 7 (9) **Block** :p_block:.
**Encode.**

messages.content: Honestly one of the worst auto cards to me. Hmm yes I'd like to spend 2 energy to make my function not activate immediately so it can activate more later in the fight.
It's not like auto's biggest flaw is a slow start, and it's biggest strength is scaling in longer fights
so this just makes your weaknesses a lot worse to make something you are already quite strong in slightly better.
What if it had "when plsyed an at the start of your turn"?
I've thrown out the idea of making it 1 cost and the upgrade being to make the function activate now and start of turn, so what you said.
The idea that this is one of the best auto cards is insane... yeah 18 metalicize is good, but this is the character that can just make 60 damage 1 cost cards
It is outright detrimental when you need the support the most.

It takes sometimes 3 turns to just go even compared to just having a 2 card function. If this is played to start a function but you can't complete the function (turn 1), then you complete the function the next turn and play it (turn 2), and it actually plays the card for the first time (turn 3)
Just to match if you just played a normal card in a function which would have an immediate effect the turn you play it, then again the 2nd turn when you play the function.
And on turn 4 it finally goes even compared to just playing the card...
It's so damn slow and once it is online you are already fine. Yeah it plays you functions for free, but I'd rather just draw and play said function.

This card is massively overrated and most decks are made worse when you take it, not even through opportunity cost, but the card is just that bad. Add in the fact that you are often taking this from a boss do you are skipping other rares like dev tools, virus, summon orb... this card is honestly horrible

Full release is a really cool card, allowing to essentially craft your own power out of the other 2 cards nestled in the function, which gives you a lot of flexibility in different types of fights. Since it's turning a function into a repeating power like demon form, it's primary job is to scale you into the late game and for longer boss fights, which It does very well. However, like with most powers/forms it's expensive and is pretty slow, as the resulting function becomes a power, so you don't get the effects of the other 2 cards until you've waited a full turn. Full Release is a very strong tool for scaling and flexibility, and really shines in the late game, seeing one late in act 3 or at the act 4 shop is usually fantastic.

On the other hand, the slowness of full release will cost you in acts 1 and 2, and it can be pretty clunky to draw it when it's essentially a curse in the early game, especially considering how little access to card draw automaton has. It's also quite possible to draw it an inopportune time, when the resulting power won't be very useful, or when you can't afford to sink all the energy into creating and casting it. 

At the same time, scaling is almost never a problem for automaton. The entire mechanic of encode is built around inherent scaling by both thinning the deck and gluing together supercards that give you 3 effects for just 1 energy. Full release makes you better at something you are already very strong at, which lowers it's utility significantly. Not until very late in the run will you need this much scaling, and you also have access to plenty of other tools to provide it (boost, fortify, philosophize, sentient form). Gets quite a bit easier to use once you have 4 energy, or upgrade it so that it only costs 1 energy. Runic pyramid is excellent with full release to let you create the right power for each individual fight. Extremely powerful with electromagnetic coil to make a bigger power.

this card was really good when I didn't figure out that the cards you drafted with automation don't acutally matter. The idea of this card is you take it with the plan to make a very strong power in your boss fights (usually stuff like goto + blockchain + full release). Its great at this job but its also on a charater who has little issues making decks that win fights in 3 turns at the most; and powers on a character with so much raw strength behind them don't get used much since they need time to pay off. If the fight is ending on that turn then you don't play full release accuse you have to wait for its effect and its even worse if full release being in your hand causes the fight to go on a turn. unfortunately automation is fine with keeping some slower cards in your deck because having tools like Virus, cultist strike and goto let you muscle past most of the game. So full release is mostly taken to help with boss fights spefically and it does a good job there.

if your interested in not playing random cards to create random functions, full release being the center of your deck is a pretty fun way to play the character; its decently effective too although still not as rewarding as the more accessible "just play virus or bug barrage" strategies.
I think this card is really similar to <devotion> in that its really damn powerful but your also just winning all of your fights before it acutally pops off.
